title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
17:15 <vmassol> hmm is it normal that this document doesn't exist anymore: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/ApplicationWithinMinutes ?  
17:16 <vmassol> it's listed on the livetable http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/#|t=designs&p=1&l=30&s=doc.name&d=asc&doc.name=App  
17:16 <vmassol> something seems amiss  
17:16 <vmassol> hmm the IRC page in the panel has a question mark too  
17:17 <vmassol> seems we're in an invalid state on xwiki.org  
17:17 <@sdumitriu> flushCache  
17:22 <evalica> has quit  
17:23 <vmassol> fixing commons build  
17:34 <+mflorea> Do you know if there is a containsIgnoreCase(Collection<String>,String) method in apache commons? I can't find one although I think this is something pretty useful.  
17:35 <@sdumitriu> org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils.containsIgnoreCase(String, String)  
17:35 <+mflorea> that's different  
17:36 <@sdumitriu> So you want to search a string in a collection  
17:36 <+mflorea> I need containsIgnoreCase(Collection<String>,String)  
17:36 <+mflorea> yes, ignoring case  
17:37 <+mflorea> I want to keep the case, but avoid duplicated items that are equal ignoring case  
17:37 <+mflorea> I wrote my own method, but it's pretty generic  
17:38 <@sdumitriu> You could implement one using org.apache.commons.collections.CollectionUtils.exists(Collection, Predicate)  
17:39 <@sdumitriu> But there's no EqualsIgnoreCasePredicate already available  
17:40 <+mflorea> yep  
18:36 <pulasthi1> has joined #xwiki  
18:39 <pulasthi> has quit  
18:58 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
19:00 <pulasthi1> has quit  
19:02 <pulasthi> has quit  
19:09 <mflorea> has quit  
19:10 <florinciu> has quit  
19:15 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
19:21 <Enygma`> has quit  
19:30 <jlamoree> has joined #xwiki  
19:34 <arkub> has quit  
19:43 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
19:46 <bblfish> has joined #xwiki  
20:08 <Chami> has left #xwiki  
20:24 <drake01> has quit  
20:34 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
21:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
21:40 <evalica> has quit  
21:55 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: how did you add xwiki-platform-colibri to 3.0 and 2.7 branches? I'd like to add xwiki-platform-tag also.  
21:56 <@sdumitriu> git merge <tag used in the final 3.0 release>  
21:56 <@sdumitriu> Adjust the pom if needed  
21:56 <@sdumitriu> git push  
21:57 <@sdumitriu> (make sure you're in the 3.0 branch)  
21:57 <+mflorea> ah, we have the tags. I was looking only at the braches  
21:57 <+mflorea> thanks  
21:57 <+mflorea> let me try  
21:57 <@sdumitriu> Make a copy of the repository first  
21:57 <@sdumitriu> In case it gets broken  
21:58 <+mflorea> I don't have local commits so it's not a problem  
22:08 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: how come the xwiki-plugin-tag-1.20 has both the plugin and the application, like it is on master?  
22:09 <@sdumitriu> Because of the way I migrated them from SVN  
22:10 <+mflorea> looks like xwiki-plugin-tag-1.20 points to the commit that added xwiki-platform-tag to master  
22:10 <+mflorea> anyway, it's good for me :)  
22:10 <+mflorea> s/good/perfect  
22:10 <@sdumitriu> I think only one of them is at the right version  
22:12 <@sdumitriu> You should remove the application directory, then merge xwiki-application-tag-1.20 as well  
22:14 <+mflorea> indeed, the application doesn't have the right version  
22:21 <vmassol> I'm going to get all git fans replying to me on twitter now that I've said: "You see how a technology like #git is complex by how many cheat sheets there are! I've seen at least 5 so far and counting (2 more today)" :)  
22:21 <vmassol> already got 3 replying in a few seconds… hehe  
22:25 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
22:28 <vmassol> has quit  
22:37 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I'll add xwiki-platform-colibri and xwiki-platform-tag in the list of modules in xwiki-platform 3.0 pom. I'm wondering if we should change their parent to xwiki-core-parent, wdyt? (for tag I'll add a pom to group the plugin and the app)  
22:37 <@sdumitriu> Yes, we should change the parent  
22:37 <+mflorea> ok, I'll do it  
22:38 <@sdumitriu> Did you manage to merge xwiki-application-tag-1.20 ?  
22:38 <@sdumitriu> I got a conflict when trying it  
22:39 <+mflorea> yes, I got the conflict with a pom from a different module, but I removed the pom from the commit and I added the 1.20 tag app pom which was missing  
22:40 <+mflorea> the rest looks good  
22:45 <@sdumitriu> Yes, poms cause a lot of merge conflicts, since they look very similar  
23:33 <hppyfeey11> has joined #xwiki  
23:34 <hppyfeey11> hi everyone, I have being reading the manual, developer guide and other documentation i can find on the XWikisite  
23:36 <hppyfeey11> Noww i am planning to make this Calendar App. Can I go ahead using java. Do you have any suggestions?  
23:37 <@cjdelisle> perhaps look at the old calander app and understand how that works?  
23:37 <hppyfeey11> I have seen the image of the old calendar but not the code  
23:38 <hppyfeey11> It consists of a calendar and allows creating/adding event only  
23:38 <@cjdelisle> if you search for it you should be able to download the .xar file, import it and look at the pages which are added.  
23:39 <hppyfeey11> I remember I did and I changed the skin of Xwiki to albatross  
23:39 <hppyfeey11> I could not upload the file  
23:40 <hppyfeey11> I saw the upload button but the upload action didn't work  
23:43 <hppyfeet11> has joined #xwiki  
23:45 <hppyfeet11> I installed the plugin under WEB-INF/lib but on my xwiki site, but i could not see the plugin name  
23:45 <hppyfeet11> my question is that - this calendar is written in java?  
23:46 <@cjdelisle> if you have to install it in WEB-INF/lib then yes it is  
23:46 <hppyfeet11> i'll do it again  
23:47 <hppyfeet11> Is it a a calendar in a java servlet using javascript?  
23:47 <@cjdelisle> something like that  
23:48 <hppyfeet11> and do you use Apache Tomcat to run the app  
23:48 <@cjdelisle> it runs in xwiki which runs on tomcat  
23:48 <hppyfeet11> ok  
23:51 <hppyfeet> has joined #xwiki  
23:51 <hppyfeet> sorry i am having software / network connection from here  
23:52 <hppyfeet> one question, the event objects have to be stored everywhere in xwiki  
23:52 <hppyfeet> what does that mean?  
23:53 <@cjdelisle> I'm not sure, what was the context?  
23:54 <hppyfeet> In the description for the Calendar Application, the second item on the list is that the Event Application should allow storing event objects anywhere in the xwiki  
23:54 <@cjdelisle> I don't know exactly what it means, you'd have to ask the person who wrote it.  
23:55 <hppyfeet> ok  
23:55 <hppyfeet> thanks  
23:55 <hppyfeet> i have to go now  
23:55 <@sdumitriu> If you look at the existing calendar application, you'll see that the events are objects attached to the Main.EventCalendar document  
23:56 <@sdumitriu> "anywhere in the wiki" means that events should be stored each in its own document  
23:56 <hppyfeet> ok  
23:56 <hppyfeet> i understand now  
23:57 <hppyfeet> what connection does it have with a database - where is the persistence layer  
23:58 <@sdumitriu> You don't touch the database or the persistence layer  
23:58 <@sdumitriu> XWiki Objects are standard elements of the domain model, and they are persisted by the XWiki platform  
23:58 <hppyfeet> ok  
23:59 <happyfeet11> has joined #xwiki
